properties.name: activityEnterAnimation
properties.summary: Animation resource to use for the incoming activity.
properties.description: This value will be ignored if animated is set to false. See "Heavyweight Window Transitions in Android" in the main description of Titanium.UI.Window for more information.

properties.name: activityExitAnimation
properties.summary: Animation resource to use for the outgoing activity (heavyweight window).
properties.description: This value will be ignored if animated is set to false. See "Heavyweight Window Transitions in Android" in the main description of Titanium.UI.Window for more information.
properties.examples:
# Examples

# Fading out a Window

win2.close({ activityEnterAnimation: Ti.Android.R.anim.fade_in, activityExitAnimation: Ti.Android.R.anim.fade_out });

properties.name: animated
properties.summary: Determines whether to use an animated effect when the window is closed.
properties.description: This property supports animated transitions on heavyweight windows except for modal windows (modal:true). See "Android Heavyweight and Lightweight Windows" in the main description of Titanium.UI.Window for more information. The transitions are on by default, but you can disable this behavior by setting this value to false.
